title: (x) Serif face found in a dutch book - Hollandse Mediaeval {Patricia}
content:
Does anyone know this one? I somehow doubt that it's ever been digitised...  
Thanks for feedback!
author: Brown Fox

comments.content:
Link or image?

Yves, are we having latency problems?
oh, sorry, the attachment got lost. Is there any way I can repost that?
Use "Insert image" below the Comment textbox. If you cannot see "Insert image", install Flash plugin for your browser.
Bizarre, it doesn't show. I'm using Safari, might that be the problem?
it seems to post random images - not even from my HD? Something wrong with the system?

After all that - one character? Do you have any more of the set?

Edit: maybe that wasn't what you were trying to ID... since it's gone now.
I forgot to tell you that it needs to have a different name. If the file name is the same as something already uploaded, it calls that one not yours.
I use only Windows, don't know about Safari. Maybe you can try Mozilla for MacOS X.
that character has nothing to do with my font. Don't know where that came from? Strange things happening...

Reminds me of Kennerley but that's not it, will keep looking.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/kennerley-bq/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131229201039/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/kennerley-bq/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/kennerley-bq/")

Ooh, I found it - [Hollandse Mediaeval](http://web.archive.org/web/20131229201039/http:/www.identifont.com/show-fontlist?1+6AQ+3Z9+7WN+EG+EFP+4FQ+2XS+AJ7+4DN+86Z+AMZ+9B6+7WY+7N5)

I think this is the first time Identifont has worked for me.
